alert.note: Alert for Wayne (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 5:55PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Wayne. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 554 PM EDT, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Law enforcement at 550pm also reported flooded roadways in the town of Goldsboro along East Ash St. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Goldsboro, Mount Olive, Walnut Creek, Seven Springs, Elroy, Brogden, Cliffs Of The Neuse State Park and Mar-Mac. - This includes the following flood prone locations... Low lying areas in Seven Springs, Stoney Creek between East Beech St & Elm St and US Hwy 13 at Falling Creek. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
